django.contrib.admin.tests

Classes

CSPMiddleware

The admin's JavaScript should be compatible with CSP.

AdminSeleniumTestCase

Do basically the same as TransactionTestCase but also launch a live HTTP

Module Contents

class django.contrib.admin.tests.CSPMiddleware(get_response)[source]

Bases: django.utils.deprecation.MiddlewareMixin

The admin’s JavaScript should be compatible with CSP.

process_response(request, response)[source]
class django.contrib.admin.tests.AdminSeleniumTestCase(methodName='runTest')[source]

Bases: django.test.selenium.SeleniumTestCase, django.contrib.staticfiles.testing.StaticLiveServerTestCase

Do basically the same as TransactionTestCase but also launch a live HTTP server in a separate thread so that the tests may use another testing framework, such as Selenium for example, instead of the built-in dummy client. It inherits from TransactionTestCase instead of TestCase because the threads don’t share the same transactions (unless if using in-memory sqlite) and each thread needs to commit all their transactions so that the other thread can see the changes.

available_apps = ['django.contrib.admin', 'django.contrib.auth', 'django.contrib.contenttypes',...[source]
wait_until(callback, timeout=10)[source]

Block the execution of the tests until the specified callback returns a value that is not falsy. This method can be called, for example, after clicking a link or submitting a form. See the other public methods that call this function for more details.

wait_for_and_switch_to_popup(num_windows=2, timeout=10)[source]

Block until num_windows are present and are ready (usually 2, but can be overridden in the case of pop-ups opening other pop-ups). Switch the current window to the new pop-up.

wait_for(css_selector, timeout=10)[source]

Block until a CSS selector is found on the page.

wait_for_text(css_selector, text, timeout=10)[source]

Block until the text is found in the CSS selector.

wait_for_value(css_selector, text, timeout=10)[source]

Block until the value is found in the CSS selector.

wait_until_visible(css_selector, timeout=10)[source]

Block until the element described by the CSS selector is visible.

wait_until_invisible(css_selector, timeout=10)[source]

Block until the element described by the CSS selector is invisible.

wait_page_ready(timeout=10)[source]

Block until the page is ready.

wait_page_loaded(timeout=10)[source]

Block until a new page has loaded and is ready.

admin_login(username, password, login_url='/admin/')[source]

Log in to the admin.

select_option(selector, value)[source]

Select the <OPTION> with the value value inside the <SELECT> widget identified by the CSS selector selector.

deselect_option(selector, value)[source]

Deselect the <OPTION> with the value value inside the <SELECT> widget identified by the CSS selector selector.

assertCountSeleniumElements(selector, count, root_element=None)[source]

Assert number of matches for a CSS selector.

root_element allow restriction to a pre-selected node.

assertSelectOptions(selector, values)[source]

Assert that the <SELECT> widget identified by selector has the options with the given values.

assertSelectedOptions(selector, values)[source]

Assert that the <SELECT> widget identified by selector has the selected options with the given values.

has_css_class(selector, klass)[source]

Return True if the element identified by selector has the CSS class klass.
